intro: Pometia pinnata f. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited pometia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with long, narrow leaflets. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing seeds. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
